body_html:
Thanks. I was able to run the .sh file generated in terminal to get the batch classification results. I tried to run the .sh file in Jupyter with the following error. Any way to modify the syntax to make it run in Jupyter?

%run Empty.sh
File "/mnt2/cyrret/Tensorflow/Empty.sh", line 1
python scripts/label_image.py --image=tf_files/classroom_photos_test/Empty/30.jpg --input_height=224 --input_width=224 --graph=tf_files/retrained_graph_classroom_LR_0.005.pb --labels=tf_files/retrained_labels_classroom_LR_0.005.txt
^
SyntaxError: invalid syntax

Also, how can I get variables to hold the classification results as below for writing to DB?

empty (score=0.99997)
twenty (score=0.00003)
fifty (score=0.00000)
eighty (score=0.00000)

body:
Thanks. I was able to run the .sh file generated in terminal to get the batch classification results. I tried to run the .sh file in Jupyter with the following error. Any way to modify the syntax to make it run in Jupyter?  

%run Empty.sh
File "/mnt2/cyrret/Tensorflow/Empty.sh", line 1
    python scripts/label_image.py --image=tf_files/classroom_photos_test/Empty/30.jpg --input_height=224 --input_width=224 --graph=tf_files/retrained_graph_classroom_LR_0.005.pb --labels=tf_files/retrained_labels_classroom_LR_0.005.txt
                 ^
SyntaxError: invalid syntax

Also, how can I get variables to hold the classification results as below for writing to DB?

empty (score=0.99997)
twenty (score=0.00003)
fifty (score=0.00000)
eighty (score=0.00000)
